item.description: The Head Pond Rail Trail in Hooksett is a flat wide trail most of the way. It is mostly shaded. There are a few places off trail along the way the dogs can access the water. There is a pond at the turn around point where the dogs can swim. As this is a line hike (you come back the exact same way) on a easy to follow mostly straight trail any one getting to hot or tired before we reach the turn around point can easily find their way back to the parking lot.
item.how_to_find_us: The parking lot for the trail head is at the intersection of Rte. 3 (Hooksett Rd.) and Post Rd near (almost opposite) Green's Marine

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Head Pond - Rail Trail Line Hike (2 miles 1 way - 4 miles round trip)
